segment.source: Install Windows PE
segment.target: Install Windows PE

segment.source: Install Windows PE
segment.target: Install Windows PE

segment.source: Install Windows PE
segment.target: Install Windows PE

segment.source: Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE) is a small, command-line based operating system.
segment.target: Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE) is a small, command-line based operating system.

segment.source: You can use it to capture, update, and optimize Windows images, which you'll do in later sections.
segment.target: You can use it to capture, update, and optimize Windows images, which you'll do in later sections.

segment.source: In this section, you'll prepare a basic WinPE image on a bootable USB flash drive and try it out.
segment.target: In this section, you'll prepare a basic WinPE image on a bootable USB flash drive and try it out.

segment.source: For this lab, you'll need two storage locations:
segment.target: For this lab, you'll need two storage locations:

segment.source: A Windows PE USB key.
segment.target: A Windows PE USB key.

segment.source: Must be at least 512MB and at most 32GB.
segment.target: Must be at least 512MB and at most 32GB.

segment.source: It should not be a Windows-to-Go key or a key marked as a non-removable drive.
segment.target: It should not be a Windows-to-Go key or a key marked as a non-removable drive.

segment.source: A storage USB key or external hard drive.
segment.target: A storage USB key or external hard drive.

segment.source: Must be at least 8GB.
segment.target: Must be at least 8GB.

segment.source: Prepare the WinPE files
segment.target: Prepare the WinPE files

segment.source: Click Start, type Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment.
segment.target: Click Start, type Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment.

segment.source: Right-click Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment and select Run as administrator.
segment.target: Right-click Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment and select Run as administrator.

segment.source: From the Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment command prompt, copy the base WinPE files into a new folder:
segment.target: From the Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment command prompt, copy the base WinPE files into a new folder:

segment.source: Repeat if you’re also deploying x86 devices:
segment.target: Repeat if you’re also deploying x86 devices:

segment.source: Adding to WinPE
segment.target: Adding to WinPE

segment.source: Mount the WinPE image:
segment.target: Mount the WinPE image:

segment.source: For some devices, add drivers:
segment.target: For some devices, add drivers:

segment.source: Note Most devices don't need this step.
segment.target: Note Most devices don't need this step.

segment.source: But if you boot WinPE later and find you can't see the screen or connect to the network, you may need to add a video or network driver.
segment.target: But if you boot WinPE later and find you can't see the screen or connect to the network, you may need to add a video or network driver.

segment.source: Unmount the WinPE image:
segment.target: Unmount the WinPE image:

segment.source: Create a bootable drive
segment.target: Create a bootable drive

segment.source: Plug in a USB key that you don't mind formatting.
segment.target: Plug in a USB key that you don't mind formatting.

segment.source: Note the drive letter it uses, for example, D.
segment.target: Note the drive letter it uses, for example, D.

segment.source: Install WinPE to an empty USB drive:
segment.target: Install WinPE to an empty USB drive:

segment.source: When prompted, press Y to format the drive and install WinPE.
segment.target: When prompted, press Y to format the drive and install WinPE.

segment.source: Repeat if necessary, plugging in a separate USB key for use when deploying x86 devices:
segment.target: Repeat if necessary, plugging in a separate USB key for use when deploying x86 devices:

segment.source: When prompted, press Y to format the drive and install WinPE.
segment.target: When prompted, press Y to format the drive and install WinPE.

segment.source: In File Explorer, right-click the drive and select Eject.
segment.target: In File Explorer, right-click the drive and select Eject.

segment.source: Try it out
segment.target: Try it out

segment.source: Connect the WinPE USB drive to your reference device.
segment.target: Connect the WinPE USB drive to your reference device.

segment.source: After WinPE starts, manually create a pagefile equal to 256 MB in the WinPE.
segment.target: After WinPE starts, manually create a pagefile equal to 256 MB in the WinPE.

segment.source: You'll need this later to deploy compressed images (CompactOS); those operations will require that WinPE has a pagefile equal to 256 MB.
segment.target: You'll need this later to deploy compressed images (CompactOS); those operations will require that WinPE has a pagefile equal to 256 MB.

segment.source: Where "C" is the Windows partition.
segment.target: Where "C" is the Windows partition.

segment.source: Turn off the device, and then boot to the USB drive.
segment.target: Turn off the device, and then boot to the USB drive.

segment.source: You usually do this by powering on the device and quickly pressing a key (for example, the Esc key or the Volume up key).
segment.target: You usually do this by powering on the device and quickly pressing a key (for example, the Esc key or the Volume up key).

segment.source: Note On some devices, you might need to go into the boot menus to choose the USB drive.
segment.target: Note On some devices, you might need to go into the boot menus to choose the USB drive.

segment.source: If you're given a choice between booting in UEFI mode or BIOS mode, choose UEFI mode.
segment.target: If you're given a choice between booting in UEFI mode or BIOS mode, choose UEFI mode.

segment.source: To learn more, see Boot to UEFI Mode or Legacy BIOS mode.
segment.target: To learn more, see Boot to UEFI Mode or Legacy BIOS mode.

segment.source: If the device does not boot from the USB drive, see the troubleshooting tips in WinPE: Create USB Bootable drive.
segment.target: If the device does not boot from the USB drive, see the troubleshooting tips in WinPE: Create USB Bootable drive.

segment.source: WinPE starts at a command line, and runs wpeinit to set up the system.
segment.target: WinPE starts at a command line, and runs wpeinit to set up the system.

segment.source: This can take a few minutes.
segment.target: This can take a few minutes.
